description: Environment and Climate Change Canada operates aerological observing stations throughout Canada. These stations complete soundings of the upper atmosphere twice daily for each day of the year. The observations are taken by releasing a gas-filled balloon with an attached instrument (radiosonde) which is tracked via one of a variety of electronic navigational methods. This attached instrument transmits meteorological data to the Canadian Meterological Center relating to temperature, humidity, wind shear and the height of standard atmospheric pressure levels for including in atmospheric models used in forecasting and global weather monitoring.

## Announcement Summary
-------------------------

The Department of Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) invites proposals for field support services for the automated radiosonde observing system (AS41) at the Inukjuak Weather Station in Inukjuak, Quebec. The contracted field support services will ensure consistency in the operation and reliable transmission of atmospheric data.

## Description of Required Services
------------------------------------

ECCC operates aerological observing stations throughout Canada to collect meteorological data, including temperature, humidity, wind shear, and atmospheric pressure levels. The contractor will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy of the AS41 system, which automatically collects and processes data. The tasks include:

* Ensuring consistency in the operation of the AS41 system
* Performing general checks and minor maintenance of the site
* Replacing the supply carousel in the AS41 system
* Assisting in the launch of radiosondes at specified times (11:15UTC and 23:15UTC)
